text:
The 39 Indians taken hostage by the Islamic State (IS) more than a year-and-a -half ago from Mosul in Iraq are alive, External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj told their families here on Sunday, based on her recent meetings with Arab and Palestinian leaders.

Ms. Swaraj, who had sought a meeting with the families which is the ninth to be held since the abductions in June 2014, assured them that the government was “fully and continuously engaged” and “every possible effort” was being made for their release.

Official sources said the Minister told them that Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas had informed her that the “Indians are alive and made to work”. — PTI
title: Indian hostages in Mosul are alive, says Swaraj
